page.content: Clubs in Crail. The Bridge Club, founded in 1975 now has 50 members. They meet weekly from September to April and play Board Bridge. The club is well-attended, mostly by older people. There is an annual subscritpion and a weekly payment for tea. Twice a year the membrs get together for a dinner and then play party bridge with prizes. The first Bowling Club was founded in 1891, then the new club was opened in 1926, and a ladies' section in 1975. They have a modern club house with a kitchen and a bar. There is an electrically controlled watering system for the 7 rinks. Teams play inter-club matches and National Competitions, season lasts April to September. Funds are raised by raffles, a gambling machine and whist drives in the winter.
